objects.name: Analytic 0046
objects.description: Detects adversary attempts to monopolize control of compromised systems by issuing service stop commands, unloading vulnerable modules, or forcefully killing competing processes. Defenders should monitor audit logs and syslog for administrative utilities (systemctl, service, kill) being invoked outside of normal change management.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: execve: Commands like systemctl stop <service>, service <service> stop, or kill -9 <pid>

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: linux:syslog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Unexpected termination of daemons or critical services not aligned with admin change tickets

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Defines specific Linux daemons and processes that should not be terminated outside maintenance windows.
Defines expected accounts permitted to execute service stop commands; deviations may be suspicious.
